summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 5 mbar), light levels (up 5792 lux), and cloud levels (up 608 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1536 m), light levels (up 8050 lux), and rainfall (down 0.3 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s cloud levels is 607.8m lower than yesterday, 1078.4m lower than past week, 1536.3m lower than past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 860m and a peak of 3110m, averaging 1265.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

Today’s dew point temperature is 0.3°C higher than yesterday, 1.4°C higher than past week, 1.6°C higher than past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 11.6°C minimum and 16.4°C maximum, with an average of 13.9°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 12.5°C and 12.2°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air. Possible light showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather may be change rapidly and become worse.
